results.title: Destiny of a man = Sudba cheloveka
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
Melancholy and sympathetic view of the tragedies suffered by a family man and WW2 POW survivor. Haunted by his experiences in a concentration camp the man has survived this appalling event by clinging to the hope of reuniting with his wife and child. Directed by, and also starring Sergei Bondarchuk, this was a successful film that with its unstinting humanism, proved the ability of Russian filmmakers to combine cinematic beauty with compassionate sentiment.

results.title: Torpedo bombers = Torpedonostsy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Films of the great victory 1941-1945”.
By interspersing historical footage with fictional narrative, this film attempts to present the precarious fighting conditions for WW2 Russian bomber pilots. The filmmaker ably captures the taxing environment in which battles were conducted and the constant danger to those serving in the armed forces. It also depicts the fraught personal lives of the pilots, under strain from wartime conditions. Based on the stories by Yuri German.

Stars Elizabeth Taylor, Diana Rigg, Len Cariou, Lesley-Ann Down, Hermione Gingold, Laurence Guittard. Features the well-known song “Send in the Clowns”. Screenplay by Hugh Wheeler.

results.title: The Waterboy
results.creator_credit: Frank Coraci, Jack Giarraputo, Robert Simonds and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: In this comedic film of sight gags Adam Sandler plays the role of Bobby Boucher, a water boy for the local college football team. Bobby cops it from all directions - his over-bearing mother (Kathy Bates), the football team and even the coach (Jerry Reed). When the coach fires him, Bobby is forced to join the rival team under Coach Klein (Henry Winkler) where he turns his talents from water boy to a star tackler setting this losing team on the road to victory. Love, glory and revenge await Bobby as he takes up his new life as a football hero and college student. Cast includes Fairuza Balk, Blake Clark and Larry Gilliard Jr.

results.title: The Other sister
results.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Alex Rose, Mario Iscovich and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: When a mentally challenged young woman returns home from an institution, she craves independence not willingly granted by her loving but overprotective mother. After meeting a mentally handicapped man, Carla experiences romance and the desire for a life unencumbered by others’ limited expectations of her. Cast includes Juliette Lewis, Diane Keaton, Tom Skerritt, Giovanni Ribisi, Poppy Montgomery, Juliet Mills.

results.title: Operation dumbo drop
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, David Madden, Diane Nabatoff and Interscope communications
results.brief_description: A jumbo-sized hit comedy. A seasoned army captain is teamed with a hard-nosed officer to conduct the “biggest” military manoeuvre ever - to secretly transport a full-grown elephant to a remote and nearly inaccessible jungle village. By land, sea and air, calamity and chaos prevail upon their hilariously mismatched team of would-be heroes. But with a little luck…and tons of hard work…they learn that no mission is impossible. Cast includes Danny Glover, Ray Liotta, Denis Leary.

results.title: Return from Witch Mountain
results.creator_credit: John Hough, Jerome Courtland, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Sequel to “Escape to Witch Mountain” this family film is full of adventure and fantasy as Tia (Kim Richards) and her brother Tony (Ike Eisenmann), both who have supernatural powers, arrive on Planet Earth for a holiday. Dr Gannon (Christopher Lee) and his offsider Letha (Bette Davis) are trying to develop a mind-control device and when the evil Dr Gannon learns of Tony’s special powers, he kidnaps him, leaving it to Tia with her telepathic powers, and a motley gang of youngsters, to rescue Tony.

results.title: Escape to Witch Mountain
results.creator_credit: John Hough, Jerome Courtland and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Two orphans develop telekinetic powers and escape from exploitative adults with the aid of a grieving widow. They retreat to Witch Mountain, discovering their powers, which include predicting the future, levitating objects and mastery over animals. This extremely popular family oriented children’s film features Eddie Albert, Ray Milland, and Donald Pleasence, with Kim Richards and Ike Eisenmann, playing the imperilled children.

results.title: Love laughs at Andy Hardy
results.creator_credit: Willis Goldbeck, Robert Sisk and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This post-WWII film of the Hardy family reflects the true-life situation of Mickey Rooney as he plays G.I. Andy Hardy returning from his tour of duty at the war. The Hardy family represents the “typcial” stereotype American family with Andy a typical American teenager, interested in cars and girls, his stern but understanding father Judge James Hardy (Lewis Stone) and his dear loving mother Mrs Hardy (Fay Holden). When Andy finds himself falling for the lovely college co-ed Kay Wilson (Bonita Granville), little does he realise what disappointments lay ahead. Delightful, light-hearted romantic comedy based on the characters created by Aurania Rouverol. Cast also includes Sara Haden, Lina Romay and Dorothy Ford.

results.title: Lilacs in the spring
results.brief_description: Based upon the stage production of Robert Nesbitt’s “The Glorious days” by Harold Purcell with original music by Harry Parr Davies. This is a song and dance romantic comedy set in London during WWII starring the ever-charming somewhat older Errol Flynn, along with Anna Neagle, David Farrar, Kathleen Harrison, Peter Graves and Helen Haye.
